intro: Guettarda bracteata, commonly known as the golden trumpet tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange tubular flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as birds and insects. The plant has opposite, simple, and often leathery leaves that are dark green in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for warm, humid climates. The genus Guettarda is part of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants.
